property.name: dfs.federation.router.default.nameserviceId
property.description: Nameservice identifier of the default subcluster to monitor.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.default.nameservice.enable
property.description: The default subcluster is enabled to read and write files.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.rpc.enable
property.description: If true, the RPC service to handle client requests in the router is enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.rpc-address
property.description: RPC address that handles all clients requests. The value of this property will take the form of router-host1:rpc-port.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.rpc-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the RPC server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of dfs.federation.router.rpc-address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.handler.count
property.description: The number of server threads for the router to handle RPC requests from clients.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.handler.queue.size
property.description: The size of the queue for the number of handlers to handle RPC client requests.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.reader.count
property.description: The number of readers for the router to handle RPC client requests.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.reader.queue.size
property.description: The size of the queue for the number of readers for the router to handle RPC client requests.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connection.creator.queue-size
property.description: Size of async connection creator queue.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connection.pool-size
property.description: Size of the pool of connections from the router to namenodes.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connection.min-active-ratio
property.description: Minimum active ratio of connections from the router to namenodes.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connection.clean.ms
property.description: Time interval, in milliseconds, to check if the connection pool should remove unused connections.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connection.pool.clean.ms
property.description: Time interval, in milliseconds, to check if the connection manager should remove unused connection pools.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.metrics.enable
property.description: If the metrics in the router are enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.dn-report.time-out
property.description: Time out, in milliseconds for getDatanodeReport.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.dn-report.cache-expire
property.description: Expiration time in seconds for datanodereport.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.metrics.class
property.description: Class to monitor the RPC system in the router. It must implement the RouterRpcMonitor interface.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.admin.enable
property.description: If true, the RPC admin service to handle client requests in the router is enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.admin-address
property.description: RPC address that handles the admin requests. The value of this property will take the form of router-host1:rpc-port.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.admin-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the RPC admin server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of dfs.federation.router.admin-address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.admin.handler.count
property.description: The number of server threads for the router to handle RPC requests from admin.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.http-address
property.description: HTTP address that handles the web requests to the Router. The value of this property will take the form of router-host1:http-port.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.http-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the HTTP server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of dfs.federation.router.http-address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.https-address
property.description: HTTPS address that handles the web requests to the Router. The value of this property will take the form of router-host1:https-port.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.https-bind-host
property.description: The actual address the HTTPS server will bind to. If this optional address is set, it overrides only the hostname portion of dfs.federation.router.https-address. This is useful for making the name node listen on all interfaces by setting it to 0.0.0.0.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.http.enable
property.description: If the HTTP service to handle client requests in the router is enabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.file.resolver.client.class
property.description: Class to resolve files to subclusters. To enable multiple subclusters for a mount point, set to org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.federation.resolver.MultipleDestinationMountTableResolver.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.namenode.resolver.client.class
property.description: Class to resolve the namenode for a subcluster.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.enable
property.description: If true, the Router connects to the State Store.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.serializer
property.description: Class to serialize State Store records.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.driver.class
property.description: Class to implement the State Store. There are three implementation classes currently being supported: org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.federation.store.driver.impl.StateStoreFileImpl, org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.federation.store.driver.impl.StateStoreFileSystemImpl and org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.federation.store.driver.impl.StateStoreZooKeeperImpl. These implementation classes use the local file, filesystem and ZooKeeper as a backend respectively. By default it uses the ZooKeeper as the default State Store.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.connection.test
property.description: How often to check for the connection to the State Store in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.cache.ttl
property.description: How often to refresh the State Store caches in milliseconds. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.membership.expiration
property.description: Expiration time in milliseconds for a membership record.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.membership.expiration.deletion
property.description: Deletion time in milliseconds for a membership record. If an expired membership record exists beyond this time, it will be deleted. If this value is negative, the deletion is disabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.heartbeat.enable
property.description: If true, the Router heartbeats into the State Store.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.heartbeat.interval
property.description: How often the Router should heartbeat into the State Store in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.heartbeat-state.interval
property.description: How often the Router should heartbeat its state into the State Store in milliseconds. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.federation.router.quota-cache.update.interval.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.namenode.heartbeat.enable
property.description: If true, get namenode heartbeats and send into the State Store. If not explicitly specified takes the same value as for dfs.federation.router.heartbeat.enable.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.router.expiration
property.description: Expiration time in milliseconds for a router state record. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.federation.router.quota-cache.update.interval.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.store.router.expiration.deletion
property.description: Deletion time in milliseconds for a router state record. If an expired router state record exists beyond this time, it will be deleted. If this value is negative, the deletion is disabled.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.safemode.extension
property.description: Time after startup that the Router is in safe mode. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.safemode.expiration
property.description: Time without being able to reach the State Store to enter safe mode. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.monitor.namenode
property.description: The identifier of the namenodes to monitor and heartbeat.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.monitor.localnamenode.enable
property.description: If true, the Router should monitor the namenode in the local machine.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.mount-table.max-cache-size
property.description: Maximum number of mount table cache entries to have. By default, remove cache entries if we have more than 10k.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.mount-table.cache.enable
property.description: Set to true to enable mount table cache (Path to Remote Location cache). Disabling the cache is recommended when a large amount of unique paths are queried.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.quota.enable
property.description: Set to true to enable quota system in Router. When it's enabled, setting or clearing sub-cluster's quota directly is not recommended since Router Admin server will override sub-cluster's quota with global quota.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.quota-cache.update.interval
property.description: Interval time for updating quota usage cache in Router. This property is used only if the value of dfs.federation.router.quota.enable is true. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.heartbeat.interval. If no suffix is specified then milliseconds is assumed.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.client.thread-size
property.description: Max threads size for the RouterClient to execute concurrent requests.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.client.retry.max.attempts
property.description: Max retry attempts for the RouterClient talking to the Router.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.client.reject.overload
property.description: Set to true to reject client requests when we run out of RPC client threads.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.client.allow-partial-listing
property.description: If the Router can return a partial list of files in a multi-destination mount point when one of the subclusters is unavailable. True may return a partial list of files if a subcluster is down. False will fail the request if one is unavailable.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.client.mount-status.time-out
property.description: Set a timeout for the Router when listing folders containing mount points. In this process, the Router checks the mount table and then it checks permissions in the subcluster. After the time out, we return the default values.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connect.max.retries.on.timeouts
property.description: Maximum number of retries for the IPC Client when connecting to the subclusters. By default, it doesn't let the IPC retry and the Router handles it.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.connect.timeout
property.description: Time out for the IPC client connecting to the subclusters. This should be short as the Router has knowledge of the state of the Routers.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.keytab.file
property.description: The keytab file used by router to login as its service principal. The principal name is configured with dfs.federation.router.kerberos.principal.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.kerberos.principal
property.description: The Router service principal. This is typically set to router/_HOST@REALM.TLD. Each Router will substitute _HOST with its own fully qualified hostname at startup. The _HOST placeholder allows using the same configuration setting on both Router in an HA setup.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.kerberos.principal.hostname
property.description: Optional. The hostname for the Router containing this configuration file. Will be different for each machine. Defaults to current hostname.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.kerberos.internal.spnego.principal
property.description:
The server principal used by the Router for web UI SPNEGO authentication when Kerberos security is enabled. This is typically set to HTTP/_HOST@REALM.TLD The SPNEGO server principal begins with the prefix HTTP/ by convention.
If the value is '*', the web server will attempt to login with every principal specified in the keytab file dfs.web.authentication.kerberos.keytab.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.mount-table.cache.update
property.description: Set true to enable MountTableRefreshService. This service updates mount table cache immediately after adding, modifying or deleting the mount table entries. If this service is not enabled mount table cache are refreshed periodically by StateStoreCacheUpdateService

property.name: dfs.federation.router.mount-table.cache.update.timeout
property.description: This property defines how long to wait for all the admin servers to finish their mount table cache update. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.federation.router.safemode.extension.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.mount-table.cache.update.client.max.time
property.description: Remote router mount table cache is updated through RouterClient(RPC call). To improve performance, RouterClient connections are cached but it should not be kept in cache forever. This property defines the max time a connection can be cached. This setting supports multiple time unit suffixes as described in dfs.federation.router.safemode.extension.

property.name: dfs.federation.router.secret.manager.class
property.description: Class to implement state store to delegation tokens. Default implementation uses zookeeper as the backend to store delegation tokens.
